fields.description:
Test file contents
* Unicode
* Other content types
fields.summary: HG: Slurp content tests

fields.description:
Identify transient vs permanent errors and report appropriately
Identify plugin errors
fields.summary: HG: Validate that slurping errors result in user-friendly feedback

fields.description: Stop indexing if we detect a 11th committer
fields.summary: HG: Validate we respect starter license limits

fields.description:
Framework for incremental slurps
* Creation of branches, followed by merging in separate slurp (named and unnamed branches)
* Other scenarios as per CRUC-3369
fields.summary: HG: Incremental Slurp test

fields.description: The 'advanced' section of the 'add repository' page for Mercurial and Git have been changed; a 'command timeout' field has been added. The confluence documentation on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Mercurial and http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Git should be updated.
fields.summary: Update Confluence doc

fields.description: On Windows, the Runtime.exec(..) cannot be called with Unicode characters in the command name or its parameters. There is a workaround using ProcessBuilder in combination with passing the unicode strings to environment vars and referencing those from the command line.
fields.summary: Fix ExternalProcess in atlassian-procesutils to work around Sun JDK bug on windows platform
HG: When browsing a file, it doesn't show the copied/moved from revisions even though they appear to be set up correctly via ancestor links.

fields.description: found a few examples where they don't and pass null down further, resulting in NPE's
fields.summary: HG: check calls to DvcsCache.getFirstMatchingHashExpansion(): they should check for null being returned

fields.description:
(_was originally Fix LoC_)

* The LoC count for hg branches is missing the initial LoC when the branch is created (automatically added to svn branches because svn branches are created as copies).  See attached screenshot.

Set this up for HG as we detect a changeset being the first of a new branch.
fields.summary: HG: fix LoC for Branches

fields.description: We need to replicate what git does here to produce a changeset for these merge commits.
fields.summary: HG: Merge commits which auto-merge produce no changeset

fields.description: check with mstudman
fields.summary: HG: Fix edit repository admin screen

fields.description:
If there is an error getting content for a file in HgScanner.indexContentBlock(), the whole indexing process is killed.

Instead, log an error and a engine error and keep going.
fields.summary: HG: Error getting content for a file stops entire indexing process.

fields.description:
* Path has been removed from config.xsd and admin screens.
* Include/exclude are present in both, but not checked in code.

Look at how git handles path/include/exclude and abstract out support if possible to reuse the code. Add support for include/exclude into hg slurping.

Have to cope with copies/moves _into_ the watched space (ancestors will not exist, so treat as new files) and copies (ignore) and moves (treat as delete) _out_ of the watched space.

Add slurp tests for include/exclude settings.
fields.summary: HG: Add support for includes/excludes to hg

fields.description: when doing diffs, if you "hg cat" for the deleted revision of a file, hg exits with a status of 1 because the file doesn't exist. We'll have to predict this and work around it.
fields.summary: HG: Don't call "hg cat" on a deleted revision

fields.description:
carry on from CRUC-3469 (which was committed in 2.3.0) improving slurp feedback.

Specifically:
* Translate obscure errors into more descriptive ones
* More ongoing feedback about what happenning
fields.summary: HG: Improve slurp feedback

fields.description:
Branch creation is detected by CRUC-3809, but we also need to detect/track:
* the head commit of a branch (latest head is fine)
* going inactive
* being closed
* being re-opened

This should occur at the end of a batch in the repo life-cycle, can use {{hg branches -v}} to list branches and get the head commit and state.

Allow for different processing to be plugged in to these states (KISS), mostly will be CRUC-3408
fields.summary: HG: Detect branch state changes

fields.description: when using the {{before tag XXX}} and {{after tag XXX}} cleases in EyeQL on a mercurial repository, no results are returned.
fields.summary: HG: EyeQL Searching by tags doesn't work

fields.description: This indicates we are producing diffs that we never index?
fields.summary: HG: DiffTextCache not getting cleaned up

fields.description:
I've configured a mercurial repository and when I go on the source page browser, I can see the directories I have removed with a hg commit command a while ago. 
Previously I was using fisheye with a SVN version of this repository, and there, my deleted directories were put in grey, with a (deleted) annotation on the file in those deleted directories.

It seems to be an issue with the mercurial plugin, which do not provide the same feature than with the SVN plugin.
fields.summary: HG: Deleted directories are always displayed in the source browser

fields.description:
currently, it seems that every tag is being processed every time indexing is run - instead, we should keep track of the commit of a tag and only process the revisions in the tag (and move them off the old revisions) if the tag has moved, been added or been deleted.

Note that each tag takes about 20 seconds to process in FE, so this slows everything down a lot.
fields.summary: HG: Tag processing should only apply tag if it has moved

fields.description:
HG/Git: In FE, doing diff between revs of a file - if click on another file in left navbar who doesn't have same revisions, gets exception.

We need some sort of closest by date on branch matching to fix this.
fields.summary: HG: DvcsFileHistory.resolveRevisionFromString needs checking for branch and tag names and best on branch

fields.description:
If the clone is missing when FishEye starts up, the scanner gets a failure in HgLinecountCalculator$HgChangesetLinecountCalculator.processBranchPoint and fails to start.
Error keeps recurring.

This happens when restoring demotions.

We need to have a check for a missing clone before this process commences.

fields.description:
When a tag is removed in a Hg repository, the incremental slurp does not process it correctly. It does work when a tag is moved however...

See HgIncrementalTest#testTags for an example of a situation that is failing.
fields.summary: Removed tags in a Hg repository are not picked up by the HgScanner

fields.summary: indexing hg changesets is taking way longer than it should

fields.description: May be related to CRUC3582
fields.summary: HG: Fix HGTagTest

fields.description:
The hg  clone and update command can support embedding the username/password in the url

e.g.

﻿hg clone https://username:password@bitbucket.org/username/privaterepo

this url contains the password in the clear, so log messages should maybe remove this. In addition, the password will be in the .hg/hgrc file of the clone, so that may need to be cleaned up.

On the other hand, these logs and rc files are in the same location as the config.xml which also contains the password in the clear, so maybe this is not necessary - check with security team.
fields.summary: HG: Support http/s authentication for repos by placing username/password into URL

fields.description: On Windows, doing a regexp escape on a file starting with "." produces a path starting with "\", which hg seems to think (on windows) is a path it can't find. This results in the symptoms found in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3859
fields.summary: HG: Error on windows for files starting with "."

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 

# Set up a git or hg repo
# Click on a file to show the revisions 
# Click on the source tab - the link goes to /repo/path/to/file?r=HEAD
# The following message is shown

!http://img.skitch.com/20100528-eg91bqyn543yp3wsm3cbbaeq7d.jpg!
fields.summary: Git + HG: Viewing the "HEAD" revision doesn't work

fields.description:
See attached.
The pop-up should be resizable for the size of the version number that could be here. 
Consult with Jake/Sharkie on ideas - could possibly use a smaller font.
For HG, the popup should also display the revid, since if we make the slider date based, we will need the revid:short hash as well.
fields.summary: HG (&GIT&ClearCase?): The hover for a changeset has the full hash, which extends outside the pop-up
support branch fallback for clearcase resolveRevisionString

fields.description:
instead it goes to the head of trunk. 

the revisions tab works correctly, ie. you can find the latest version of a file from a tag, but clicking on the Source tab takes you to HEAD of trunk instead of taking you to what you are looking at. Also, clicking on the file links in the directory tree should take you to the correct version.

this should (might?) be relatively easy to do using a simliar method to the revisions tab.
fields.summary: going to HEAD of a tag goes to the wrong place

fields.description:
When clicking on "Edit Details" on any review, we're seeing a greyed out screen with the spinning wheel.  it never goes away.  

This is happening on chrome, firefox, and safari for mac as well as firefox for PC. 

Our crucible installation has LDAP integration setup.
fields.summary: When clicking "edit details", screen spins forever.

fields.description:
In clearcase, whenever an element is checked out, it is common for a branch to be created with element 0.  Element 0 is a placeholder for the file and is rarely useful to look at.  The effect is that crucible/fisheye shows 2 files whenever somebody checks in an element (version 0 and version 1 for that branch).  So, the activity looks like duplicate files are being checked in all the time.

Would be nice to have a configuration option for the vob to specify whether to ignore the 0 element on a branch or not.  I imagine that most people want to ignore this version (element 0).
fields.summary: Clearcase plugin - Provide ability to ignore element 0

fields.description:
Clearcase is slow and takes forever to import into crucible (estimated 38 days for 750 branches, ~20,000 elements), so it is necessary to specify what branches to import.  However, whenever a branch is added (for say a new release to monitor), a rescan of the whole repository is required.  When monitoring a handful of branches, this usually takes at least 24 hours.  

Would be a huge feature to be able to specify a branch with a wildcard.  Like "sir*_build", which would match previous branches (e.g. sir01_build, sir02_build, ... and future releases like sir55_build or whatever).  This would allow the new branch to be included without having to reconfigure crucible and perform a full rescan of the repository. 

Wildcards are supported in other parts of crucible (e.g. Exclude/Include directories under the Allow(Process) tab), so wouldn't think this feature would be too hard to add.
fields.summary: Clearcase plugin - Add support for wildcards for branch name.

fields.description:
When creating a review in Crucible from a Fisheye changeset, the title of the review is only populated up to the first newline.

We should provide a configurable option that allows the title to be populated with as much content of the commit message as possible.
fields.summary: Crucible titles from SVN commits should allow newlines

fields.description:
When the connection to the VOB server is interrupted during indexing, a huge stacktrace (repeated 3 times) is displayed in the admin. This error should be cleaned up, or replaced with a more generic error along the lines of 'Error connecting to ClearCase server'

Note that indexing resumes when the connection is restored.
fields.summary: ClearCase: Error in the admin are too verbose when a ClearCase repo loses connection with the server

fields.description: In some git repositories, tag processing and branch head determination can take significant time delaying the availability of commits for review operations. Where the associated functionality is not a high priority for users, this option will allow users to disable these operations. This is a short term tactical option prior to a git indexing rearchitecture.
fields.summary: Add option to disable git head detection and tag processing

fields.description:
Unfortunately, base clearcase has no concept of transactions (or changesets) unlike many other SCM providers.  Many tools try to simulate this for clearcase by grouping a set of changes for a particular user by time.

For crucible, it appears that this is done at a one second interval.  This makes the activity page unuseful, as it is usually filled up with 1 or 2 developers that checked in a dozen or so files.  The activity page shows the users with a dozen or so transactions, each with a single file in them.

Would be good to be able to either customize this window (e.g. specify to group them together in 30-60 second windows) or better yet, use an algorithm like what some other tools use (like CruiseControl.Net).  Once they see activity for a particular user, they monitor the repository waiting for a specified amount of time of inactivity for that user before calling it a transaction/changeset.  So, if they see inactivity for say 1-5 minutes, then they call it a transaction.

This would greatly cleanup the activity page, represents changesets for clearcase in a much more meaningful way, and makes the tool much more usable for code reviews (now can click on this changeset to do a code review, rather than the dozen changesets that were spaces apart by a second or two).
fields.summary: Clearcase plugin - Ability to better represent a user transaction/changeset for base clearcase

fields.description:
By default, SVNKit will shutdown any SSL connection to the repository after 60 min if the property {{http-timeout}} is not defined in the Subversion configuration. See {{DefaultSVNAuthenticationManager.getReadTimeout()}} and [this|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-4782?focusedCommentId=1458077&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_1458077] for details.

As a consequence, even if the FishEye's property "Svn Operations Timeout" is set to more than 60 minutes, the property will have no effect, as SVNKit will shutdown the connection anyways after 60min.

_Resolution_: FishEye should override SVNKit's default time out with its "Svn Operations Timeout". This can be done by subclassing the {{DefaultSVNAuthenticationManager}} and overriding its method {{getReadTimeout}}. It has to be investigated how this new authentication manager can be plugged in inside SVNKit.

Context: [FSH-4782|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-4782]
h3.Workaround
Refer to the workaround in [SVN Operations Taking Longer than an Hour Time Out|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/SVN+Operations+Taking+Longer+than+an+Hour+Time+Out]
fields.summary: SVNKit makes FishEye abort any SVN command after 60min if the property http-timeout is not set in the SVN config

fields.description:
When configuring a clearcase repository by adding/removing branches to the "Branches to Include" rule, a full rescan of the repository is performed when saved. This can take hours (and often days) to perform.

Would be nice if this page was smarter.  If a branch is added to the list, then only rescan for that branch and add the contents to crucible/fisheye, rather than throwing away all the data and starting over.  Also, if a branch is removed, just remove the data for this branch (rather than performing a full rescan).

Since crucible/fisheye already processes a single branch at a time during a full rescan, seems like the underlying system would be able to handle this capability.
fields.summary: Clearcase plugin - Smarter rescan logic when adding/removing branches.

fields.description:
The repository configuration page for ClearCase tries to show all options for both ClearCase Base and ClearCase UCM. This results in an overly complex configuration screen that is hard to figure out.

Some of the things that are unclear or plain wrong:
* _View Location_: depending on whether you select 'auto create view' the meaning of View Location differs. If auto create view is selected, it is the directory in which FishEye will create the view. If it is not selected, it should point to an existing view directory. What does this setting mean when you're indexing multiple VOBs/UCM Projects? FishEye needs a view per VOB/UCM Project, but you cannot configure this.
* _Include/Exclude VOBS_: You can specify include and exclude rules at the same time. It does not make sense to do this and it's unclear what this means.
* _Include/Exclude ..._: The syntax is unclear and undocumented. For vobs you need to enter vob:/vob_tag, for projects project:project_tag@/vob_tag.The UI could be easily improved.

h5. UCM only
When UCM is selected it's even worse:
* _VOB to include_: should only contain PVOBS.
* _UCM Projects to include_: if VOB to include is specified or include/exclude rules have been defined, the 'UCM Projects to include' should be limited to possible items.
fields.summary: ClearCase repository configuration in FishEye administration is overly complicated and incomplete

DB migration: fix incorrect message "The database is case insensitive. Crucible requires that the database use a case sensitive collation" to reflect the current check: "The database is not Unicode. Crucible requires ..."

fields.description:
E.g. the below link was just a simple link to http://localhost:6060/foo/plugins/servlet/confluencescm

!http://img.skitch.com/20101111-c2spcrswibfn799uib3e3kn6h6.medium.jpg!
fields.summary: Make "Configure plugin" links non-Javascripty

fields.description:
In ClearCase UCM, commits are grouped into activities. The contents of an activity can change over time, with file revisions being moved from 1 activity to another. 

FishEye currently stores the amount of revisions it has indexed as being part of the activity and only re-indexes the activity when the number changes. This is a brittle approach (e.g. adding 1 file revision and removing another won't change the count) and should be improved.
fields.summary: ClearCase UCM activity support is brittle (detection of modified activities etc.)

fields.description:
This involves quite a few API changes. Most importantly is in Tokenizer and IndexSearcher.
Also - unbounded searches are now only possible by using a Collector.

There are quite a few potential performance improvements that could help us.
It is also a good exercise to audit existing lucene implementation, and ensure we are up to date with best practices.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Lucene 3.0
Add ant globs support in the file paths
Performance: recomputation of the empty dirs after a new commit causes the repository view (browse/myrepo) to be very slow

fields.description:
FishEye is currently storing the VOB information into 'branch' fields in the internal FishEye data structures.  This was done to accommodate the possibility of repositories containing multiple VOBs to index.  

Investigation into whether it is feasible to store the actual ClearCase branches in the FishEye branch fields should be performed.
fields.summary: FishEye is treating VOBs as 'branch'

fields.description:
The FishEye official docs do not have an easily findable page containing the list of supported languages (for syntax highlighting):

- http://www.google.com.au/search?q=supported+languages+fisheye
- http://www.google.com.au/search?q=syntax+highlighting+fisheye

This is one of the most frequently asked question about FishEye: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=187433181]

The current doc only specifies how to define your own syntax highlighting, which is a more advanced topic: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCKB/Defining+your+own+syntax+highlighting+in+Crucible+or+Fisheye].
fields.summary: Add an official doc containing the supported languages of FishEye

fields.description:
Needed to get a base line reference with AtlasEye-QA

By default, FishEye determines when to upgrade the metadata indexes using a version number defined in the code {{LuceneIndexes.METADATA_VERSION}}. When this version does not match the persisted version number (stored in InfinityDB), the metadata index is automatically upgraded.

Currently, this is done by removing any duplicated data as we reindex, using the InfinityDB id associated with each path (see {{CommonIndexer.insertPath(..)}}). However, following the metadata index change in (CRUC-5139), we now detect duplicate using logical paths instead of the InfinityDB id. Thus, without any changes, the existing data will not be dropped.

This task is to remove the index every times we upgrade the metadata index.
fields.summary: When upgrading metadata index, remove old index

fields.description:
FishEye does not currently support LoC stats or charts for Git repositories.

Add in support for these.

Note we had support in 2.3, but it was based on some code which worked really well for "linear" VCSs like SVN and CVS, but it was broken for DAG based commit graph systems like Git (and Mercurial: CRUC-4505). We are working on a better solution, but vote here to increase it's priority.
fields.summary: Git: Support Lines of Code statistics and charts

fields.description:
Some issues are similar to CRUC-3682

Currently stores a single predecessor and a single ancestor: scope work to support all repository types, with a single primary predecessor/ancestor (for backward compatability) but add ability to get alternate ancestor(s).

* git supports multiple parents
* hg supports a primary parent and a merge (secondary) parent
* (future work) svn, clearcase, p4 supports merging.

Downstream, this will enable support for:
* Showing multiple parents in browse/revisions (possibly by a subtle pop-up we can eliminate/change later, or a parent(s) column)
* Graph view for revisions of a file, possibly as a sister tab to browse/Revisions (e.g. browse/Graph)
* In browse/Revisions, option for 3-way diff of merges
fields.summary: HG & Git: Store multiple ancestors in file revisions

fields.description:
2.5 Added ssh authentication support for git and hg repositories, but only supports uploading private keys without passphrases.

Add support for uploading private keys with passphrases.
fields.summary: HG/Git ssh authentication: support for private keys with passphrases

Note we had support in 2.3, but it was based on some code which worked really well for "linear" VCSs like SVN and CVS, but it was broken for DAG based commit graph systems like Mercurial (and Git: CRUC-4524). We are working on a better solution, but vote here to increase it's priority.
fields.summary: HG: Support Lines of Code statistics and charts

See https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/Authentication+for+DVCS+Hosts

*Authentication Options:
** No Authentication Required

** SSH KeyPair (generated) - we show the public key on view and at create time: helptext on url to indicate the url form for git/hg - url should include the username
** Upload SSH Private key - upload option, helptext as above
** Upload SSH Private key (with passphrase) - upload option with separate passphrase input. helptext as above
** SSH Username/Password - username and password - helptext as above but url should NOT contain username

fields.summary: Windows Testing of hg & git

fields.description:
Goal: include SSH authentication tests in the FECRU integration tests (part of CI).

FishEye can be configured to pass in a SSH private key to the SSH command that git and hg use to access remote repositories that are secured using SSH. 
We need to test whether the interaction between git/hg, ssh and FishEye are all going as planned. The goal is not to test ssh, but to verify that the chain of input/output streams between the different processes is working as expected. (e.g. FishEye not choking on ssh warnings that are echoed in gits output)

To do this, we want to set up a git and hg repository on an external server that is accessible from the Bamboo builds and secure the repositories with ssh. This comes down to:

*External server*
* setting up a user on the server.
* configuring ssh to allow access for a given SSH key pair. 
* installing git and hg  on the server.
* setting up a small git repository on the server.
* setting up a small hg repository on the server.

*Integration test*
* write a git integration test with an ssh server configuration that points to the external server
* write a hg integration test with an ssh server configuration that points to the external server
fields.summary: Integration Test for hg & git
Implement Windows Git passphraseless key support

fields.description: either remove the password from visible logging or implement a stdin approach

http/s authentication for hg: check if we can avoid passing password in url on commandline
Add to config the username/password store for http/s/git authentication for git/hg

fields.description:
See parent issue:
* We don't want to expose the username/password in ps listings or logging, so may need to monitor challenge response
* Investigate what is technically feasible, to the point where we can estimate a solution next sprint
fields.summary: Implement hg username/password http authentication

fields.description:
Multiple Clone support is targetted at the UI level for 3.1, but we are doing preparatory work in this release.

* Document the potential use-cases for multiple clone support
** the obvious one is to mimic the github network graph - show me clones out there that have changes I don't have
** Which clones is this commit in?
** Do a review on code in my personal clone and when accepted, push the work to a central clone (review should still work and be linked to both clones commit)
** etc. gather more from other team members,  including blue (visualisation) team
* Consider potential implementations
** Performance implications of implementing use-cases
** Unacceptable addition of complexity to code and reducing maintainability must be minimised
** How to manage - add/remove clones - implications on indexing, removing commits?

One potential we have considered is to pull all changes into our clone and then use hg outgoing to detect which clones don't have the commits we have. Keep a separate index of which commits are available in which clones.
fields.summary: Document and Design Multiple DVCS Clone Support

fields.description:
There are a number of problems with Activity Streams, some of which are:
* Performance
* filtering by branch excludes ChangeSets with no file revisions
* Render time performance of building the ChangeSet description
* For DVCSs, the Activity Stream (and revision list) show only commits committed to a branch, not commits/file revisions contributing to a branch (and if we remove this from git, we need to replace it with something)

Thus:

* Identify and Document the performance problems of the activity streams 
* Design and Document a solution that covers the above problems, coping with different requirements of different VCS types.

Consider also the work specified as part of CRUC-3696
fields.summary: Document and Design Activity Stream improvements

fields.description:
Git does not support the concept of which branch a commit was committed to, which FishEye uses widely. Currently, we synthesis this as being "the branch we were processing the ancestors of when we first saw the commit". If the do a reindex, this totally changes.

DAG based VCSs like git and hg add extra complexity to the question "what changes are in this version?", due to the amount of branching and merging that can happen. A single commit can contribute to many branches and it is important to know which it does contribute to and which it doesn't.

Scope:
Need to be able to list the branch heads/pointers and tags that a changeset contributes to, meaning is an ancestor of.

Most likely to be done from the changeset end, so list all branches and tags a changeset is included in, but could also be is changeset X an ancestor of changeset Y.

* List use cases for this functionality, starting with showing the heads and tags a changeset contributes to. Gather other use-cases.
* Produce a high-level design or designs for providing this information in an efficient (perhaps with time/space tradeoffs listed) manner.
** Consider indexing time, UI render time, moving/deleting tags and branch pointers (git).
* Identify other parts of the system affected by moving git code to use this model only and removing its use of the "committed to" functionality (hg will use both, as it supports both) e.g. activity stream filtering, revisions lists etc.
fields.summary: Document and Design ChangeSet "visible from XXX" functionality
Git: Support server authentication

fields.description: Documentation: write up should come from a best-practices ssh key management approach - i.e. use a separate key for FE/Bamboo, add to a user that has read-only access on your repositories etc. See "Key Management" https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/Authentication+for+DVCS+Hosts
fields.summary: Document ssh support
